QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following would cause the aggregate demand curve to shift to the left?
With an upward sloping short-run aggregate supply curve, an increase in government expenditure will most likely
AnswerChoices: Reduce the level of nominal gross domestic product
Shift the short-run aggregate supply curve to the right
Shift both the aggregate demand curve and the long-run aggregate supply curve to the left

QuestionStatement: Which of the following are the most likely short-run effects of an increase in government expenditures?

Assume that an economy is currently in long-run equilibrium and short run aggregate supply curve is upward sloping.  An adverse supply shock, such as a drought, will most likely cause which of the following to the economy in the short run?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the price level and a decrease in the nominal wage
A decrease in the price level and an increase in the nominal wage
An increase in the price level and an increase in the nominal wage
An increase in the price level and an increase in the real wage
An increase in the price level and a decrease in the real wage

QuestionStatement: Which of the following best explains the increase in national income that results from equal increases in government spending and taxes?
AnswerChoices: Consumers do not reduce their spending by the full amount of the tax increase
The government purchases some goods that consumers would have purchased on their own anyway
Consumers believe all tax cuts are transitory
The increase in government spending causes a decrease in investment
Consumers are aware of tax increases but not of increases in government spending

QuestionStatement: A simultaneous increase in inflation and unemployment could be explained by an increase in which of the following?
An increase in which of the following would be most likely to increase long-run growth?
AnswerChoices: Subsidies to business for purchases of capital goods

QuestionStatement: Suppose that in an economy with lump-sum taxes and no international trade, autonomous investment spending increases by $2 million.  If the marginal propensity to consume is 0.75, equilibrium gross domestic product will change by a maximum of
Which of the following would be the initial impact on an economy if wages were to increase more than worker productivity?
AnswerChoices: There would be no initial impact, since neither the aggregate supply curve nor the aggregate demand curve would shift
Employment would increase, causing a rightward shift in the aggregate demand curve
The price level would increase, resulting in excess aggregate supply
The short-run aggregate supply curve would shift to the left, increasing the price level
The aggregate demand curve would shift to the left, increasing the price level

QuestionStatement: The shifting of a country’s production possibility curve to the right will most likely cause
AnswerChoices: The aggregate demand curve to shift to the left
The long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left
The long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right

QuestionStatement: One explanation for the downward slope of the aggregate demand curve is that when the price level increases, which of the following will decrease?

Assume that Jane’s marginal propensity to consume equals 0.8 and that in 2004 Jane spent $36,000 from her disposable income of $40,000.  If her disposable income in 2005 increased to $50,000, her consumption spending increased by
Which of the following is LEAST likely to promote economic growth?
AnswerChoices: Increase in consumption of nondurable goods
Increase in the labor force participation rate

QuestionStatement: An increase in spending in an economy will cause a multiplied increase in gross domestic product because
AnswerChoices: government spending is greater than zero

An increase in which of the following would most likely result in an increase in aggregate supply?
The graph above shows two aggregate demand curves, AD1 and AD2, and an aggregate supply curve, AS. The shift in the aggregate demand curve from AD1 to AD2 could be caused by
AnswerChoices: a decrease in the money supply
an increase in the price level

QuestionStatement: If wages are sticky, which of the following policies will be the most effective in raising real gross domestic product to the full-employment level?
AnswerChoices: Doing nothing, since there are automatic stabilizers
The sale of bonds by the Federal Reserve
An increase in the income tax
An increase in the discount rate

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely cause an increase in real output in the long run?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the labor force participation rate
An increase in the velocity of money
An open-market sale of government bonds by the central bank
An increase in immigration from abroad
An increase in the price level

QuestionStatement: The short-run aggregate supply curve would be vertical if
AnswerChoices: nominal wages adjust immediately to changes in the price level
nominal wages adjust slowly when there is unemployment
both nominal wages and prices adjust slowly to changes in aggregate demand
the spending multiplier is very low
investment demand is very responsive to _changes in interest rates

QuestionStatement: A rightward shift of the short-run Phillips curve is most likely due to
AnswerChoices: a decrease in the expected rate of inflation
an increase in the expected rate of inflation

QuestionStatement: If the marginal propensity to consume is 0.75, then a $100 increase in investment will result in a maximum increase in equilibrium real gross domestic product of
On the graph above, stagflation will be caused by a
AnswerChoices: leftward shift in the short-run aggregate supply curve only
rightward shift in the short-run aggregate supply curve only
leftward shift in the aggregate demand curve only
rightward shift in the aggregate demand curve only
rightward shift in both the short-run aggregate supply and aggregate demand curves

QuestionStatement: As a component of aggregate demand, investment refers to the
AnswerChoices: purchase of raw land for later resale
purchase of new equipment and additional inventories
difference between people’s income and spending
